channel.title: Chapter 6: Errors and Debugging on Introduction to Web Dev
channel.description: Recent content in Chapter 6: Errors and Debugging on Introduction to Web Dev

item.title: Reading
item.description: Reading Content What is Debugging? Categories of Errors Diagnosing Error Messages Error Types Debugging Logic Errors How to Avoid Debugging Asking Good Questions

item.title: Exercises: Debugging
item.description: Imagine we are running a space station. Your job is to evaluate the station’s code and fix any errors. The lives of the crew rest squarely upon your shoulders. Your directions from superiors: Launch the shuttle only if the fuel, crew and computer all check out OK. If a check fails, print that information to the console and scrub the launch. If all checks are successful, print a countdown to launch in the console.

item.title: Next Steps
item.description: After reading through this chapter, you are ready to start learning about strings! Here are some additional resources on errors and debugging in case you are interested. How to Debug Errors in Your Source Code Cornell Lecture on Debugging
